gameMembers

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMembers.Drawable
      • gameMembers.EnvironmentMember
        • gameMembers.Bullet

  • public class Bullet
extends EnvironmentMember
    This class is used to represent a bullet in the game.
    It defines a constant velocity, and given where the mouse pointer is, creates a trajectory for itself across the screen.
    Author:
    Hughes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bullet(float vel, float px, float py, float cx, float cy)
      The constructor for the class takes two sets of coordinates: The player(or other bullet origin)'s location (px, py) and the cursor (or destination of the bullet)'s coordinates (cx, cy) and converts them into a vector that the bullet travels along.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void updateLoc()
      updateLoc
      This method updates the location of the bullet based on its velocity.

      • Methods inherited from class gameMembers.EnvironmentMember

        changeScaleRelativeToScreen, draw, getCenter, getHitbox, getImage, getScale, intersects, setScale

      • Methods inherited from class gameMembers.Drawable

        getLoc, getX, getY, setLoc, setX, setY

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet(float vel,
              float px,
              float py,
              float cx,
              float cy)
        The constructor for the class takes two sets of coordinates: The player(or other bullet origin)'s location (px, py) and the cursor (or destination of the bullet)'s coordinates (cx, cy) and converts them into a vector that the bullet travels along.
        Parameters:
        px - the x coordinate origin of the bullet
        py - the y coordinate origin of the bullet
        cx - the x coordinate destination of the bullet
        cy - the y coordinate destination of the bullet

    • Method Detail

      • updateLoc

        public void updateLoc()
        updateLoc
        This method updates the location of the bullet based on its velocity. This is meant to be called from an update method in a state class.
